chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
P = fun a : Z => forall b : Z, have_gcdZ a b : Z -> Set
lt_absZ = fun x y : Z => ltZ (absZ x) (absZ y) : Z -> Z -> Prop
recZ : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : Z, P p
Zrec1 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> P OZ
Zrec2 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ 0 P
Zrec4 : forall P : Z -> Set, (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> forall p : nat, and_recZ p P
Zrec3 : forall (P : Z -> Set) (p : nat), (forall n : Z, (forall m : Z, lt_absZ m n -> P m) -> P n) -> and_recZ p P -> and_recZ (S p) P
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
and_set_set_set_rec : forall (S1 S2 : Set) (P : and_set_set_set S1 S2 -> Set), (forall (s : S2) (s0 : S1), P (and_set_set_set_i S1 S2 s s0)) -> forall a : and_set_set_set S1 S2, P a
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
tech_lt_abs_OZ : forall x : Z, lt_absZ x (pos 0) -> x = OZ
BinInt.Z.le_le_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> BinInt.Z.le n (BinInt.Z.succ m)
BinInt.Z.mul_pos_pos : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 m -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.mul n m)
BinInt.Z.add_pos_pos : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 m -> BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.add n m)
BinInt.Z.add_neg_neg : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.lt m BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.add n m) BinNums.Z0
lt_OZ : forall m : Z, ~ ltZ (absZ m) OZ
Znat.inj_minus2 : forall n m : nat, m > n -> BinInt.Z.of_nat (n - m) = BinNums.Z0
minus_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, m < n -> Init.Nat.pred (n - m) = n - S m
OrderedRing.Rplus_nonneg_pos : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop), OrderedRing.SOR rO rI rplus rtimes rminus ropp req rle rlt -> forall n m : R, rle rO n -> rlt rO m -> rlt rO (rplus n m)
Nat.le_antisymm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> m <= n -> n = m
BinInt.Z.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 p -> BinInt.Z.lt n m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.mul p n) (BinInt.Z.mul p m)
Nat.sub_lt : forall n m : nat, m <= n -> 0 < m -> n - m < n
BinInt.Z.double_above : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) n) (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)) (BinInt.Z.mul (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) m)
eucl_dev : forall n : nat, n > 0 -> forall m : nat, diveucl m n
Record SOR (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_SOR_theory { SORsetoid : Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req; SORplus_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 ->...-> rlt rO (rtimes n m); SORneq_0_1 : ~ req rO rI } Arguments OrderedRing.SOR [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments OrderedRing.mk_SOR_theory [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [rplus rtimes rminus ropp req]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.lt_gt : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m -> BinInt.Z.gt m n
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
BinInt.Z.min_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le m n -> BinInt.Z.min n m = m
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
gt_not_le : forall n m : nat, n > m -> ~ n <= m
gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
lt_le_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n <= m
Zorder.Zgt_le_succ : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.gt m n -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.succ n) m

```  
intros n P H.
apply H.
apply Zorder.Zgt_le_succ.
apply BinInt.Z.gt_lt.
apply BinInt.Z.lt_gt.
unfold lt_absZ in H.
apply H.
Qed. 
```

original: intros n P H. apply H. apply Zorder.Zgt_le_succ. apply BinInt.Z.gt_lt. apply BinInt.Z.lt_gt. unfold lt_absZ in H. apply H.
